Description: THE FISCAL YEAR 2022 RESTORE MITIGATION PROGRAM GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY  TCEQ  UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THREE INDIVIDUAL PROJECTS  THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECTS UNDER THE PROGRAM IS TO MITIGATE HARM TO FISH, WILDLIFE, AND NATURAL RESOURCES  THESE PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES IN THE CITY OF PORT LAVACA AND ALONG THE TEXAS REGION OF THE GULF OF MEXICO  THE SUBRECIPIENT FOR EACH PROJECT IS AS FOLLOWS   1  TEXAS REEF INITIATIVE  SUBRECIPIENT  TEXAS PARKS AND WILDLIFE DEPARTMENT ,  2  CITY OF PORT LAVACA SHORELINE CLEAN UP  SUBRECIPIENT  CITY OF PORT LAVACA , AND  3  LAVACA RIVER ABANDONED OIL WELLS  SUBRECIPIENT  RAILROAD COMMISSION OF TEXAS

THE TEXAS GULF SHRIMP CONSUMPTION, TOURISM AND MARKETING PROJECT IS AWARDED TO TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO DEVELOP AND PERFORM MARKETING AND TOURISM STRATEGIES THAT WILL EDUCATE CONSUMERS ABOUT TEXAS GULF SHRIMP AND COASTAL TOURISM. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO PROMOTE THE CONSUMPTION OF SEAFOOD HARVESTED FROM THE GULF COAST REGION AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR TEXAS SHRIMPERS BY MEETING CURRENT DEMANDS AND CHALLENGES FACED BY THE INDUSTRY. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT TEXAS COASTAL COMMUNITIES WHERE THE TEXAS SHRIMPING INDUSTRY OPERATES. THE SCOPE OF WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY SUBRECIPIENT, TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE.

THE TEXAS MASTER PLAN FOR BENEFICIAL USE OF DREDGED MATERIAL PROJECT IS AWARDED TO TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO CREATE A PLANNING DOCUMENT AND TOOLS FOR THE BENEFICIAL USE OF DREDGED MATERIAL ALONG THE TEXAS GULF COAST. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO CREATE A PLAN THAT WILL IDENTIFY PLACEMENT AREA LOCATIONS WHERE DREDGE MATERIALS MAY BE DEPOSITED. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE TEXAS COASTAL COMMUNITIES. THE SCOPE OF WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY SUBRECIPIENT, DUCKS UNLIMITED.
FY20 RESTORE PROMOTION OF TOURISM BKT 1
FY20 RESTORE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT (BKT 1)
FY19 RESTORE FLOOD PROTECTION (BKT 1)
FY19 RESTORE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION (BKT 1)
FY16 RESTORE PLANNING (DIRECT BKT 1)

THE WASHINGTON AVENUE GATEWAY GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO PROVIDE ROADWAY UPGRADES TO THE HIGHWAY 609 WASHINGTON AVENUE CORRIDOR. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO CONSTRUCT PEDESTRIAN FRIENDLY FEATURES SUCH AS SIDEWALKS, CROSSWALKS, TRAFFIC SIGNALS, AS WELL AS A MEDIAN TO BETTER CONTROL ACCESS. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, JACKSON COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE HANCOCK COUNTY TECHNOLOGY PARK ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO SUPPORT INFRASTRUCTURE BENEFITTING THE ECONOMY OF THE GULF COAST REGION THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF MULTIPLE ACTIVITIES LOCATED AT THE HANCOCK COUNTY TECHNOLOGY PARK AT STENNIS INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO SUPPORT THE CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF THE HANCOCK COUNTY TECHNOLOGY PARK AND INCREASE AVAILABLE CAPACITY TO HOUSE CURRENT AND FUTURE TENANTS. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, THE HANCOCK COUNTY PORT AND HARBOR COMMISSION, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE GRANT.

THE COMMERCIAL PROVING GROUNDS FOR SPACE TO SEAFLOOR ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO PROVIDE AN AVENUE FOR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT THAT IS REQUIRED TO SUPPORT THE TEST RANGE AND SUPPLY DOMAIN-SPECIFIC TECHNICIANS TO SUPPORT THE AUTONOMOUS SYSTEMS INDUSTRY AT LARGE. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO DEVELOP, CREATE, AND IMPLEMENT TEST RANGES FOR UNMANNED AIRCRAFT AND MARITIME VEHICLES IN THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION TO SUPPORT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT NEEDS IN THE INDUSTRY. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, THE NATIONAL OCEANS AND APPLICATIONS RESEARCH CENTER, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE GRANT.

THE MCCC PARKING LOT SAFETY AND SECURITY IMPROVEMENTS GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO SUPPORT INFRASTRUCTURE BENEFITTING THE ECONOMY OF THE GULF COAST REGION BY SUPPORTING THE MISSISSIPPI COAST COLISEUM AND CONVENTION CENTERS SITE CAPACITY IMPROVEMENT, WHICH WILL ENHANCE OPPORTUNITIES TO ATTRACT MORE CONVENTIONS AND EVENTS. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO IMPLEMENT SITE SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS AT THE MISSISSIPPI COAST COLISEUM AND CONVENTION CENTER. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, MISSISSIPPI COAST COLISEUM AND CONVENTION CENTER, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE HANCOCK COUNTY FAIRGROUNDS REVITALIZATION GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO SUPPORT INFRASTRUCTURE BENEFITTING THE ECONOMY OF THE GULF COAST REGION BY PROVIDING NEEDED INFRASTRUCTURE AND FACILITY UPGRADES FOR THE HANCOCK COUNTY FAIRGROUNDS TO ATTRACT ENHANCED TOURISM OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO IMPLEMENT SITE AMENITIES AND FACILITIES IMPROVEMENTS AT THE HANCOCK COUNTY FAIRGROUNDS. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, HANCOCK COUNTY, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE GRANT.

THE GULF COAST SMALL BUSINESS INCUBATOR CAPACITY ENHANCEMENT PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND JOB CREATION IN THE ECONOMY IN THE GULF COAST REGION BY SUPPORTING SMALL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT AND GROWTH. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE NORTHERN GULF AQUATIC FOOD RESEARCH CENTER PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO DEVELOP A FACILITY THAT WILL ENABLE MSU TO PROVIDE ANALYTICAL SEAFOOD SAFETY TESTING AND FOOD SCIENCE CAPABILITIES TO SUPPORT THE GULF SEAFOOD INDUSTRY. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, MISSISSIPPI STATE UNIVERSITY, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE HARRISON COUNTY RAIL LINE REPAIR AND UPGRADES PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO MAKE REPAIRS AND UPGRADES TO THE EXISTING RAIL SPUR INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICING THE BERNARD BAYOU INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, THE HARRISON COUNTY DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE PLANNING ASSISTANCE - MULTIYEAR IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (MIP) AMENDMENT AND APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT GRANT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF AMENDMENTS TO THE MIPS AND FOR ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH GRANT APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT FOR PROJECTS ON THE ACCEPTED MIP. THE MIP IS A STATUTORY PREREQUISITE FOR RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE UNDER THE RESTORE DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE BROADWATER MARINA RESTORATION PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OFENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY  MDEQ  UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO REPAIRAN EXISTING MARINA INFRASTRUCTURE FOR IMMEDIATE PUBLIC USE AND FUTURE TOURISM AND ECONOMICDEVELOPMENT  THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COASTREGION  THE SUBRECIPIENT, MISSISSIPPI SECRETARY OF STATE, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THEPROJECT

GULFPORT BILOXI AIRPORT SITE MITIGATION AND IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TOMISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY  MDEQ  UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECTCOMPONENT PROGRAM TO CREATE A CONSTRUCTION READY SITE TO FACILITATE AERONAUTICAL DEVELOPMENTOPPORTUNITIES AT GULFPORT BILOXI INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT OPERATED BY THE GULFPORT BILOXI REGIONALAIRPORT AUTHORITY  THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COASTREGION  THE SUBRECIPIENT, THE GULFPORT BILOXI REGIONAL AIRPORT AUTHORITY, WILL CARRY OUT THESCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT

THE GULF SEAFOOD MARKETING PROGRAM PROJECT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE PROMOTION OF THE CONSUMPTION OF GULF SEAFOOD. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO IMPLEMENT SEAFOOD MARKETING AND PROMOTION EFFORTS AND TO PROMOTE THE CONSUMPTION OF SEAFOOD HARVESTED FROM THE GULF COAST REGION. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF MARINE RESOURCES, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE GULF COAST TOURIST WAYFINDING AND INFORMATIONAL SIGNAGE PROJECT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT TOURISM PROMOTION ON THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST THROUGH WAYFINDING AND INFORMATIONAL SIGNAGE. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO STIMULATE THE ECONOMY AND PROMOTE TOURISM BY ATTRACTING MORE VISITORS AND ENHANCE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE IN THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGIONAL CONVENTION AND VISITORS BUREAU WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI OCEAN ENTERPRISE ENTREPRENEURSHIP PROGRAM PROJECT IS AWARDED TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO DEVELOP A COMBINED DEGREE PROGRAM WITHIN EXISTING UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI UNITS THAT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN BOTH OCEAN ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS PRINCIPLES. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVE IS TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE USM OCEAN ENTERPRISE ENTREPRENEURSHIP PROGRAM TO PROVIDE WORKFORCE TRAINING AND JOB CREATION. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI WILL CARRY OUT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT.

THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MDEQ) IS AWARDED A GRANT UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO CARRY OUT THE CITY OF MOSS POINT INTERSTATE10 COMMERCIAL CORRIDOR IMPROVEMENTS INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT, WHICH INVOLVES IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TRANSPORTATION NETWORK IN THE CITY OF MOSS POINT'S I-10 COMMERCIAL DISTRICT THEREBY ENHANCING THE ABILITY TO STIMULATE ADDITIONAL ECONOMIC ACTIVITY IN THE AREA. THE PROJECT INCLUDES PLANNING, ENGINEERING, DESIGN, PERMITTING, AND CONSTRUCTION TO IMPLEMENT ROADWAY INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS FOR BETTER ACCESS TO EXISTING BUSINESSES, SUPPORT ADDITIONAL COMMERCIAL ACTIVITY, ENHANCE TRAVELER SAFETY, AND REDUCE CONGESTION. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT IS THE CITY OF MOSS POINT.

THE HOLLYWOOD ROAD EXTENSION BRIDGE OVER BAYOU BLACK PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO TERREBONNE PARISH UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO FACILITATE TRAVEL TO AND FROM TERREBONNES MAJOR SHOPPING CORRIDOR FOR THOSE RESIDENTIAL AREAS SITUATED IN THE WESTERN PART OF TERREBONNE PARISH ALONG BOTH SIDES OF BAYOU BLACK. THE AWARD WILL FUND THE CREATION OF A TRANSPORTATION CONNECTION BETWEEN THE HOLLYWOOD ROAD EXTENSION AND LA HWY 182 AND COMPLETION OF THE HOLLYWOOD ROAD CORRIDOR IN TERREBONNE PARISH FROM EAST OF HOUMA TO THE WEST, CREATING AN ALTERNATE ARTERIAL ROUTE FOR CROSS PARISH TRAFFIC. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF TERREBONNE PARISH.THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE BAYOU TERRE AUX BOEUFS RIDGE ARMORING PROJECT IS AWARDED TO ST. BERNARD PARISH UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR THE INSTALLATION OF APPROXIMATELY 6,200 LINEAR FEET OF LIMESTONE ALONG ONE OF THE MOST VULNERABLE STRETCHES OF THE BAYOU TERRE AUX BOEUFS RIDGE SHORELINE AND 68 ACRES OF CYPRESS-TUPELO PLANTINGS IMMEDIATELY ADJACENT TO AN EXISTING REACH OF THE BAYOU TERRE AUX BOEUFS RIDGE. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS SHORELINE PROTECTION CONSISTING OF A CONTINUATION OF THE BAYOU TERRE AUX BOEUFS RIDGE ARMORING (PHASE 1) PROJECT WHICH WAS COMPLETED IN 2020, BY THE COASTAL PROTECTION AND RESTORATION AUTHORITY (CPRA). THIS PROJECT WILL COMPLETE PHASE 2 OF THE OVERALL PROJECT, FROM BAYOU GENTILLY TO BAYOU LERY NEAR DELACROIX, ST. BERNARD PARISH, LOUISIANA. THE PARISH ANTICIPATES THAT THIS PROJECT WILL PROTECT APPROXIMATELY TWENTY (20) ACRES OF THE EXISTING LIVE OAK-HACKBERRY HABITAT ON THE RIDGE AND HELP SUSTAIN THE LANDFORM WHILE OTHER LARGESCALE RIDGE RESTORATION EFFORTS ARE FUNDED. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF ST. BERNARD PARISH. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE ISLENOS COMMUNITY ARCHIVE PROJECT IS AWARDED TO ST. BERNARD PARISH UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR THE RENOVATION OF AN EXISTING WING OF THE NUNEZ COMMUNITY COLLEGE LIBRARY. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO CREATE AN EXHIBIT SPACE THAT WILL FEATURE A RARE COLLECTION OF ISLENOS (DESCENDANTS OF THE CANARY ISLANDS) ARTIFACTS DONATED TO THE SCHOOL BY THE DIRECT DESCENDANTS OF EARLY ST. BERNARD PARISH SETTLERS FOR THE PROMOTION OF TOURISM. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE ECONOMY OF THE COMMUNITIES OF ST BERNARD PARISH BY PROMOTING TOURISM AND THE CONSUMPTION OF GULF SEAFOOD AT LOCALES NEAR HISTORIC ISLENO SITES AND WATERWAYS THROUGHOUT ST. BERNARD PARISH. THE SUBRECIPIENT, NUNEZ COMMUNITY COLLEGE, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE MULTIYEAR IMPLEMENTATION PLAN UPDATE PREPARATION GRANT IS AWARDED TO PLAQUEMINES PARISH GOVERNMENT UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO SUPPORT UPDATES TO THE MULTIYEAR IMPLEMENTATION PLAN BASED ON CURRENT FUNDING NEEDS AND PROJECT PRIORITIES AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE PLAQUEMINES PARISH AND THE GULF COAST REGION. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS ON THIS GRANT.

THE EAST BANK LAND BRIDGE PROJECT - PHOENIX TO LAKE LEARY PROJECT IS AWARDED TO PLAQUEMINES PARISH UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO INITIATE THE PLANNING, ENGINEERING, DESIGN, AND GATHERING OF BEST AVAILABLE SCIENCE INFORMATION THAT SUPPORT COASTAL RESTORATION OBJECTIVES TO REESTABLISH VEGETATIVE HEADLAND RIDGES WITHIN THE VICINITY OF GRAND LAKE AND LAKE LEARY AND TO REESTABLISH ADJACENT MARSHES IN THE PROJECT AREA USING MISSISSIPPI RIVER SEDIMENT. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE ROCKEFELLER REFUGE SHORELINE STABILIZATION PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO CAMERON PARISH UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT A RESTORATION PROJECT TO COMPLETE ENGINEERING, DESIGN, AND CONSTRUCTION FOR THE ROCKEFELLER REFUGE  THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO REDUCE THE SHORELINE EROSION ALONG APPROXIMATELY 6,000 LINEAR FEET  1 14 MILES  OF GULF SHORELINE  THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE GULF COAST REGION  THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS AWARD

THE WESTWARD EXPANSION OF THE CWPPRA ROCKEFELLER REFUGE GULF SHORELINE STABILIZATION PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO CALCASIEU PARISH UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT A RESTORATION PROJECT WHICH IS TO INSTALL AN ADDITIONAL 0 3 MILES OF ROCK BREAKWATERS WITH A LIGHT WEIGHT AGGREGATE CORE, STARTING AT THE WESTERNMOST END OF THE ME 37 ROCKEFELLER REFUGE GULF SHORELINE STABILIZATION PROJECT  THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO REDUCE THE SHORELINE EROSION ALONG GULF SHORELINE  THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE GULF COAST REGION  CAMERON PARISH IS THE SUBRECIPIENT THAT WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT
CALCASIEU RIVER SALINITY CONTROL

WALTON COUNTY RDC2021000377 COASTAL DUNE LAKE HYDROLOGICAL RESTORATION PROJECT 10THE COASTAL DUNE LAKES HYDROLOGICAL RESTORATION PROJECT AWARDED TO WALTON COUNTY, FLORIDA UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM IS TO CONSTRUCT A NEW 40-FOOT PRECAST CONCRETE BRIDGE AND SUPPORTING COMPONENTS ON COUNTY ROAD 30A BETWEEN COUNTY ROAD 83 (SOUTH COUNTY HIGHWAY/OLD BLUE MOUNTAIN ROAD) AND COUNTY ROAD 283 (SOUTH) OVER LITTLE REDFISH LAKE. THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING CULVERT AND PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE WHICH WILL OCCUR DURING THE CLEARING AND GRUBBING OF THE SITE. APPROXIMATELY 680-FEET OF ROADWAY AND MULTI-USE PATH WILL BE REALIGNED, AND NEW DRAINAGE SYSTEM WILL BE CONSTRUCTED. PROJECT GOALS INCLUDE CONSTRUCTING A NEW ROAD BRIDGE FOR MOTORISTS' SAFETY WHILE RESTORING THE CONNECTION AND CIRCULATION OF LITTLE REDFISH LAKE, A COASTAL DUNE LAKE, AND IMPROVE THE ASSOCIATED NATURAL COMMUNITIES. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE GULF COAST REGION.THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT ON THIS PROJECT.
PLANT REMOVAL AND HABITAT IMPROVEMENT IN WALTON COUNTY'S RARE COASTAL DUNE LAKES PROJECT 3

THE NORTH SANTA ROSA WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT  WWTP  GRANT IS AWARDED TO SANTA ROSA COUNTY, FLORIDA UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO CONSTRUCT A WASTEWATER FACILITY AT 8580 TRANSITION ROAD, MILTON, FL 32583  THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT A NEW WASTEWATER TREATMENT FACILITY WITH CAPACITY UP TO 6 0 MGD CAPACITY THAT WILL RESULT IN INCREASED CAPACITY TO THE SERVICE AREA WITHIN THE COUNTY  THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES IN SANTA ROSA COUNTY  THE SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT IS THE CITY OF MILTON

THE PASCO ENERGY AMP; MARINE CENTERS RESTORATION AMP; RESEARCH PROJECT GRANT AWARDED TO PASCO COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT RESTORATION PROJECTS THAT WILL IMPROVE THE SALT SPRINGS RUN ESTUARY IN PORT RICHEY, FLORIDA. THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO INCREASE ECOLOGICAL SERVICES AND FUNCTIONS IN THE SURROUNDING ESTUARY, DURNEY KEY, AND NEAR SHORE HABITATS. THE PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF PASCO COUNTY. THE SUBRECIPIENT, PASCO COUNTY SCHOOL39;S ENERGY AND MARINE CENTER EMC WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECTS.

THE STORMWATER PROGRAM (DESIGN AND PERMITTING) PROJECT IS AWARDED TO OKALOOSA COUNTY, FLORIDA UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO PROVIDE PLANNING ASSISTANCE FOR THE DESIGN AND PERMITTING OF STORMWATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS IN OKALOOSA COUNTY. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONTROL AND MITIGATE STORMWATER FLOODING WITHIN THE COUNTY. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE STORMWATER MODELING, PIPE INSPECTION, AND DESIGN FOR FUTURE CONSTRUCTION OF STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IN THE DRAINAGE BASINS THAT INCLUDES THE LIST OF PROJECT SITES. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF OKALOOSA COUNTY. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE ROBINSON PRESERVE EXPANSION PHASE III COASTAL HABITAT ENHANCEMENTS PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO MANATEE COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT TO SUPPORT RESTORATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION ACTIVITIES. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO COMPLETE THE COASTAL RESTORATION AT THE ROBINSON PRESERVE EXPANSION THROUGH UPLAND PLANTINGS ALONG SHORELINES TO BUFFER THE INTERTIDAL WATER FEATURES CREATED TO PROTECT JUVENILE FISH HABITATS. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENTS, MOTE MARINE LABORATORY AND FLORIDA FISH AND WILDLIFE CONSERVATION COMMISSION, WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE PROJECT.

THE CANTONMENT COMMUNITY CENTER PLANNING PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, AND PERMITTING OF THE CANTONMENT COMMUNITY CENTER. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO DESIGN A HIGH-QUALITY COMMUNITY CENTER ON COUNTY-OWNED PROPERTY, THAT WILL BE USED AS A WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING CENTER, ADULT EDUCATION CENTER, CENTER FOR TUTORING, SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER, RECREATION CENTER AND HOUSING ASSISTANCE CENTER. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES IN ESCAMBIA COUNTY. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE LITTLE SABINE BAY RESTORATION PLANNING PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, AND PERMITTING OF RESTORATION WORK IN LITTLE SABINE BAY. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PLAN AND DESIGN IMPROVEMENTS TO LITTLE SABINE BAY THAT WILL ENHANCE WATER QUALITY AND HABITATS IN LITTLE SABINE BAY. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF ESCAMBIA COUNTY. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE PALAFOX COMMUNITY CENTER PLANNING PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT, DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, AND PERMITTING OF THE PALAFOX COMMUNITY CENTER. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PLAN AND DESIGN A HIGH-QUALITY COMMUNITY CENTER ON COUNTY-OWNED PROPERTY THAT WILL BE USED AS A WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING CENTER, ADULT EDUCATION CENTER, CENTER FOR TUTORING, SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER, RECREATION CENTER AND HOUSING ASSISTANCE CENTER. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PALAFOX NEIGHBORHOOD IN ESCAMBIA COUNTY. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE CRA INFRASTRUCTURE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PLANNING PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, AND PERMITTING OF A 5-MILE TRAFFIC CORRIDOR ON PALAFOX STREET IN PENSACOLA FLORIDA. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO DESIGN A NON-VEHICULAR ROUTE THAT SAFELY CONNECTS COMMUNITIES NORTH OF DOWNTOWN PENSACOLA. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES IN ESCAMBIA COUNTY. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE PERDIDO KEY GULF OF MEXICO PUBLIC ACCESS PLANNING PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, AND PERMITTING OF THE PUBLIC ACCESS POINTS ALONG PERDIDO KEY. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PLAN AND DESIGN THE BEACH ACCESS POINTS THAT WILL ENABLE VISITORS TO SAFELY VISIT THE GULF OF MEXICO. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES IN THE GULF COAST REGION. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE BROWNSVILLE COMMERCIAL INCUBATOR AND COMMUNITY CENTER RENOVATION PLANNING PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, AND PERMITTING OF BROWNSVILLE COMMERCIAL INCUBATOR AND COMMUNITY CENTER RENOVATION. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PLAN AND DESIGN A FACILITY THAT WILL REVITALIZE AND ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE WITHIN THE IMMEDIATE AREA BY ENCOURAGING PRIVATE SECTOR REINVESTMENT THAT PROMOTES ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF ESCAMBIA COUNTY. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

PROJECT ABSTRACT: THE PERDIDO KEY MULTI-USE PATH PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY, FLORIDA UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE EAST SEGMENT OF THE PERDIDO KEY MULTI-USE PATH FROM THE WESTERN BOUNDARY OF PERDIDO KEY STATE PARK TO RIVER ROAD FOR A LENGTH OF APPROXIMATELY 4.3 MILES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO LOCAL AMENITIES AND BUSINESSES TO IMPROVE THE LOCAL ECONOMY. THE COMMUNITIES OF ESCAMBIA COUNTY WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT FOR THIS PROJECT.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION FOR USASPENDING.GOVESCAMBIA COUNTY RDC2021000389 PERDIDO BOAT RAMPTHE PERDIDO BOAT RAMP PROJECT AWARDED TO ESCAMBIA COUNTY, FLORIDA UNDER THE RESTORE ACT, DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM IS TO CONSTRUCT A PUBLIC BOAT LAUNCH FACILITY WITH ASSOCIATED PARKING, ACCESS ROAD, STORMWATER MANAGEMENT FACILITY, ACCESSORY PIERS, PICNIC PAVILION, AND PORTABLE TOILET PAVILION WITHIN A 32.99-ACRE PARCEL LOCATED ADJACENT TO HERON BAYOU (BRIDGE CREEK) OF PERDIDO BAY IN ESCAMBIA COUNTY. PROJECT GOALS INCLUDE CONSTRUCTING A PUBLIC BOAT RAMP WHILE PROVIDING COUNTY RESIDENTS AND VISITORS A PUBLIC ACCESS POINT TO COUNTY WATERWAYS. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE EAST BAY LIVING SHORELINE AND SEAGRASS PROJECT GRANT IS AWARDED TO BAY COUNTY, FLORIDA UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO FUND MARSH AND SEAGRASS ENHANCEMENTS ON STATE-OWNED SOVEREIGN SUBMERGED LANDS TO RESTORE AND PROTECT NATURAL RESOURCES. DIRECT COMPONENT FUNDS WILL RESTORE APPROXIMATELY 5 ACRES OF A LARGER 600-ACRE COMPLEX OF MARSHES AND SEAGRASSES. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE SEDIMENT CAPTURE AND ALLOW NATURAL SYSTEMS TO MIGRATE AND ADAPT TO SEA LEVEL RISE OVER TIME. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE GULF COAST REGION. THE SUBRECIPIENT, THE NATURE CONSERVANCY WILL CARRY OUT THE PROJECT SCOPE OF WORK.

THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION AND NATURAL RESOURCES (ADCNR), AN ELIGIBLE APPLICANT AS DESIGNATED BY THE ALABAMA GULF COAST RECOVERY COUNCIL REQUESTED BY APPLICATION $14,111,594.00 IN DIRECT COMPONENT FUNDS FOR BALDWIN COUNTY ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (ALDOT) CAPACITY IMPROVEMENTS - PROJECT 4 NORTH. THE CITY OF GULF SHORES, ADCNR'S SUBRECIPIENT, WILL COMPLETE THE CONSTRUCTION; THE TOTAL COST FOR THIS PROJECT IS $14,111,594.00. ALDOT CAPACITY PROJECT 4 NORTH, IS ONE OF FIVE ROAD IMPROVEMENTS PROJECTS INCLUDED IN ADCNR'S MULTIYEAR IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (MYP) PROJECT #8. TREASURY ACCEPTED ADCNR'S MYP ON NOVEMBER 19, 2018. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND INCLUDE MULTI-MODAL CONNECTIVITY IN BALDWIN COUNTY, AL.

THIS GRANT IS AWARDED TO THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION AND NATURAL RESOURCES UNDER THE RESTORE ACT DIRECT COMPONENT PROGRAM TO COMPLETE A ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES INTERSECTION IMPROVEMENTS AT SR 181 AND SR 161 (PROJECT 3B). THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECTS ARE TO IMPROVE ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE, FACILITATE JOBS CREATION, AND SUPPORT FURTHER ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF BALDWIN COUNTY?S ECONOMY. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COMMUNITIES OF BALDWIN COUNTY, ALABAMA. ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (ALDOT) IS THE SUBRECIPIENT THAT WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY MDEQ IS AWARDED A GRANT UNDER THE RESTORE ACT CENTERS OF EXCELLENCE RESEARCH GRANTS PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE MISSISSIPPI-BASED RESTORE ACT CENTER OF EXCELLENCE MBRACE, A CONSORTIUM LEAD BY THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI, ESTABLISHED THROUGH A COMPETITIVE PROCESS TO ISSUE SUBAWARDS TO RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH ON THE GULF COAST REGION. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO HAVE MBRACE FOCUS ON SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND MONITORING IN AT LEAST ONE OF THE FIVE ELIGIBLE DISCIPLINES SPECIFIED IN THE RESTORE ACT AND TREASURY39;S IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS AT 31 CFR 34.704B. THE RESEARCH PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE MISSISSIPPI GULF COAST REGION. MDEQ WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE AWARD IN CONCERT WITH THE SUBRECIPIENT MBRACE.

THE FLORIDA INSTITUTE OF OCEANOGRAPHY FIO IS AWARDED A GRANT UNDER THE RESTORE ACT, CENTERS OF EXCELLENCE RESEARCH GRANTS PROGRAM TO ESTABLISH CENTERS OF EXCELLENCE COES THROUGH COMPETITIVE SUBAWARDS TO RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH ON THE GULF COAST REGION. THE OBJECTIVES IS TO HAVE THE COES FOCUS ON SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND MONITORING IN AT LEAST ONE OF THE FIVE ELIGIBLE DISCIPLINES SPECIFIED IN THE RESTORE ACT AND TREASURYS IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS AT 31 CFR 34.704B. THE RESEARCH PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES OF THE GULF COAST REGION. FIO WILL CARRY OUT THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE AWARD IN CONCERT WITH THE FOLLOWING SUBRECIPIENT RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS, EACH OF WHICH IS A DESIGNATED CENTER OF EXCELLENCE PERFORMING RESEARCH IN ONE OR MORE OF THE ELIGIBLE DISCIPLINES SPECIFIED IN THE RESTORE ACT AND TREASURYS IMPLEMENTING REGULATIONS AT 31 CFR 34.704B FLORIDA STATE UNIVERSITY PANAMA CITY AND THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA.
